Our Story
OBSESSED WITH THE BEST

For three generations now, Daley Seafoods has been processing and selling seafood harvested from the rich and pristine fishing grounds of the North Atlantic. We provide customers around the globe with the tastiest seafood available anywhere. It’s not a job – it’s a family passion.

MORE
HARVESTING DELICIOUSNESS

The clean, icy-cold, and nutrient-rich waters of the Gulf of St. Lawrence are the perfect breeding ground for world-renowned North Atlantic lobster and snow crab. They thrive in this environment, as do a number of other seasonally harvested species. By locating our modern processing plants nearby, we ensure we capture all that texture and taste. The result is seafood that sets a global bar for excellence.

Our Products
LOBSTER TAILS

The biggest treat from one of the ocean’s greatest delicacies.

MORE

Our Products
LOBSTER MEAT

Our North Atlantic Lobster, with its clean, sweet, North Atlantic flavour, is also rich in vitamins and minerals.

MORE

Our Products
SNOW CRAB

This sublime crustacean is world-renowned for both its sweet taste and tender texture.

MORE

Our Products
NORTH ATLANTIC LOBSTER

But its rich, delicious meat is also a tremendous source of protein, and full of rich Omega-3 fatty acids.

MORE

Our Plants
CLOSER MEANS FRESHER

Our processing plants are located close to where the seafood is harvested. Less time lost in transit means fresher tasting seafood. We own four highly modernized seafood plants, all located on the North Atlantic coast. Each is designed and built to process specific seafoods.

MORE
JOIN A TEAM THAT’S BOTH COMMITTED AND RESPECTED

Our company’s reputation is built and maintained by the people who work here. We know and appreciate that. So, we believe that the best way to maintain that reputation is to treat our employees well. If they are paid fairly, given responsibility, and work in a clean and safe environment, they’ll do what it takes to maintain and enhance our standards and reputation. If you are interested in being part of that kind of work environment, we’d like to hear from you.

OUR STORY

At Freshwater Fish, we pride ourselves on providing the world’s finest wild-caught freshwater fish products sustainably harvested from pristine Canadian lakes.

From the heart of Canada’s inland commercial fishery – we are world-renowned for high quality products and consistent supply dating back to 1969.

READ MORE

Ibusaped Maio Conse Sunt Omnis Alia Santiatu

123
OUR PRODUCTS

Freshwater’s brand represents a global benchmark for top quality wild-caught Canadian freshwater fish. In the Midwest United States, walleye marketed by Freshwater is a premier choice for chefs when placing walleye on their menus. Freshwater is a large and trusted supplier of lake whitefish and lake whitefish caviar to Finland and a key supplier of tullibee roe in Scandinavia. We continue to be the dominant supplier to the northern pike market in France, both with minced and new product innovations. We are the largest individual supplier of freshwater fish products to the American gefilte fish market and maintain a kosher-certified processing facility.​

Freshwater has earned a solid reputation based on product reliability, quality and safety. We are a recognized industry leader with an internationally established and highly endorsed brand of excellence.

SEE OUR PRODUCTS
OUR COMMITMENTS
Freshwater Fish has played a pivotal role in meeting the unique needs of Canada’s commercial inland fishery for over 50 years. The Corporation’s purpose remains true to its 1969 legislated mandate in its current mission statement: To maximize long term returns to commercial fishers through securing supply, creating an orderly market, promoting international markets and increasing trade in freshwater fish. Canada’s commercial inland fishery and Freshwater Fish have contributed to the economic prosperity of many fishing communities in western and northern Canada for over half a century.
123
RECIPES
Our recipe collection reflects a balance of healthy options, delectable tastes and easy preparation techniques. You’ll find a wide array of recipes, representing different cuisines and flavours, for the novice home cook or the experienced chef.​
DOWNLOAD OUR RECIPE BOOK
STAY CURRENT

Staying current helps keep customers and fishers up to date on the latest stories, events and news from Freshwater Fish. Check back often, as we are regularly updating information.

FISHERMAN'S MARKET - QUALITY SEAFOOD & LOBSTER

Welcome to Fisherman’s Market, the ultimate one-shop-does-it-all fishmonger. We’re a retailer, wholesaler, and exporter of fresh, frozen, smoked, and salted seafood. We’re world-renowned for serving up mouth-watering live and frozen Atlantic lobster. And we’re involved in every aspect of the fishing industry—from our boats and buying stations right at the wharf, to hand-filleting more than 20,000 pounds of freshly caught fish, each and every day.

READ MORE
RESPONSIBLY SOURCED, RESPONSIBLY PREPARED

Since 1948, Fisherman’s Market Fisherman’s Market has led the way in providing authentic Atlantic seafood. We were one of the first federally regulated seafood plants in Canada, and we continue to go above and beyond globally recognized certification programs throughout our handling, preparation, and storage processes. You can be confident in every Fisherman’s Market product you bring home.

QUALITY FIRST

ABOUT BOUVRY EXPORTS OUR MEATS COUNTRIES WE SERVE HORSE EID INFO ANIMAL WELFARE CONTACT US ENGLISH 
High-quality Canadian meats since 1982

For more than three decades, we have worked alongside restaurants, distributors and retailers, ensuring the highest food safety, animal welfare and employee safety throughout our supply chain. We take pride in the entire process, from the farmland, to the livestock, to the processing facilities. Because we raise our own animals as well as the crops they eat, we can provide unmatched quality.

As we strive to maintain our high standards and improve our processes, we continue to integrate our farms and feedlots so we can easily track our quality and supply from start to finish. It also allows us to maintain constant supply, so you never need to worry about backorders or long waits.

Thanks to our time in the industry, we have become a major player in the production and export of high quality Canadian meats, including bison, elk, horse and beef. Along with our sister company, Viande Richelieu, we own and operate two federally inspected facilities, one in southern Alberta, and the second in Quebec. By controlling the farmland, breeding, livestock, feed and processing of our animals, we ensure nothing but the highest quality across our entire operation.

  
  
  
  

Our Meats
BEEF

Our beef is high-quality, from the cattle right down to the land they are raised on. We ensure that all cattle receive high protein feed to guarantee superb marbling in every cut. For more information about our Canada-raised beef, download our brochure.

EU CERTIFIED HORMONE-FREE
AGE VERIFIED
GRADED ACCORDING TO STRICT CANADIAN STANDARDS
BISON

Our Bison is committed to producing high-quality bison meat. Our pasture breeding program, which places bison back in their natural habitat, ensures that we produce only the best bison meat. By monitoring the bison throughout their lives, we have unparalleled control of our entire supply chain.

RAISED WITHOUT THE USE OF ADDED GROWTH HORMONES
MINIMUM HUMAN INTERACTION FOR REDUCED ANIMAL STRESS
AGE VERIFIED AND GRADED FOR EXPORT
ELK

Our elk is raised in the Canadian prairies by passionate ranchers. Our direct work with ranchers ensures constant supply and high-quality meat. For more information about our Canadian elk meat, download our brochure.

CONSISTENT SUPPLY OF PRODUCTS AVAILABLE
FULL TRACEABILITY, ENSURING OPTIMUM HEALTH AND MEAT QUALITY
NATURALLY RAISED AND FREE OF GROWTH ENHANCERS
HORSE

Bouvry have been providing high-quality horse meat for over 35 years. Animal welfare is our priority, and our traceability program ensures total traceability for every horse in our supply chain. It’s just part of our commitment to high-quality, safe, gourmet meat products. For more information about our Canadian horse meat, download our brochure.

RAISED WITH ANIMAL WELFARE IN MIND
TRACEABILITY
UNDER STRICT GOVERNMENT REGULATION AND SURVEILLANCE

Our meats are inspected by the Canadian Food Inspection Agency and we are Hazard Analysis Critical Control Point (HACCP) certified.

Quality runs deep at Bouvry.
Our first butcher shop, Maison Bouvry, opened as a family business in Paris in 1887. Over 100 years later, a sense of pride and dedication to quality drives
our entire operation.

Countries We Serve

Thanks to our premium, tamper-proof packaging and first-rate shipping timelines, we deliver all over the world and have our own distribution company in Europe, Equus SAS. All of our meats also come with a high degree of traceability – even when our products are shipped all over the globe, they can be traced back to their origin.

We are approved and certified to export meat to:

YOUR CRAFT CALLS FOR THE BEST INGREDIENTS
CANADIAN MALT STEEPED IN PARTNERSHIP AND TRADITION.

Our roots as a maltster trace back to 1832, as do the knowledge, relationships and values our team continues to cultivate today. The connections we have with growers, brewers and distillers, as well as the communities they serve, have made us an intrinsic part of this remarkable industry for more than 100 years.

EXCEPTIONAL TASTE COMES FROM EXCEPTIONAL MALT

From the grains we select, all the way through the malting process, we tailor aroma, colour and flavour for our customers. Our diverse offering honours the craft, creativity and range of today’s brewers and distillers.

OUR SAFETY COMMITMENT

Our safety efforts are summed up by our goal: Zero Harm. Our Safety Management System is based on the international safety standard OHSAS 18001:2007. Each of our malt houses are 18001 registered and continually strive for improved safety systems. Our goal is simple: we want every member of our team to be able to go home at the end of each workday and fully enjoy their families and lives.

We test more than 100 grain and malt samples every day to verify superior quality, taste, and functionality. From there, maltsters take the grains through even steeping, controlled germination and artful kilning.

For the Love of Fish!
Quality. Year-round Availability. Traceability. Sustainability. Passion.
It’s what sets Presteve apart.
;
Quality. Availability. Traceability. Sustainability. Passion.
It’s what sets Presteve apart.
Quality

At Presteve, the fact that we manage every step of the process is reflected in our high-quality product. From hauling in the nets full of fresh caught fish to delivering your order to your door, high standards are met every step of the way. 

Traceability & Sustainability

Each load of fish we bring in from the fresh Great Lakes water can be traced back to the boat it came from and the day it was caught. Presteve takes every measure to ensure fish and seafood are harvested in an environmentally-conscious manner.

Delivered fresh & fast!

Presteve is uniquely able to secure product availability year-round through a vital combination of quota ownership and strategically-positioned multi-plant processing near water’s edge. Our trucking and delivery is best in the business due to our precise logistics management that gets our fish from lakefront to storefront on time, as ordered.

We do fresh caught best

Presteve is #1 in delivering wild-caught, fresh-water fish to North America. We are on the lakes, year round, catching, processing, delivering the fish consumers want most…and in abundance.

"We source the highest quality ingredients at the most competitive prices -- for you. After 40 years in the business, it's what we do best." -- Baba Shah, President
From the very beginning and spanning across two generations as a family business, there's one thing we cherish more than anything: our relationships. We love the business, from buying at the right time to selling at a fair price. And the people we work with make it a joy to be in this business.

That’s why at Shah Trading Company, we are able to source the best ingredients from around the world at the best price. We leverage our relationships to ensure we are one of the first to secure ingredients either during harvest time or when an ingredient is scarce. We work tirelessly behind the scenes, on your behalf, to secure the product you need, at the right price, delivered to your door, every time.

We invite you to browse our new website to learn how Shah Trading Company can help you grow and support your business. Learn about the ingredients we carry, our trusted brands, both old and new, and our new canning facility. Learn how we source our products or how to use them in a meal. Feel free to contact us with any questions you might have or book a tour at one of our facilities. Thank you for your interest in Shah Trading Company!

Welcome to Louisbourg Seafoods

Louisbourg Seafoods Ltd., home of Mira Bay seafood products, is a family-operated seafood business. James and Lori Kennedy, owners, credit the company's success with their levels of control and expertise at all stages of seafood production.

The company harvests its product using its own fleet of vessels, and has direct control over each stage of production. This innovative Nova Scotian company is commited to the conservation and care of ocean species and habitat.

CERTIFIED ANGUS BEEF® FEATURE
GET TO KNOW OUR COMMITMENT TO PARTNERSHIP
WHO WE ARE

With roots dating back to 1834 at Toronto’s historic St. Lawrence Market, Macgregors Meat & Seafood Ltd. is arguably one of Canada’s longest standing family-owned purveyors. After 3 generations of Macgregor family ownership, the business joined the Gordon Food Service group of Specialty Companies, remaining proudly family owned. A dedicated true Centre-of-the-Plate Specialist™, we remain Canada’s only operation to process both raw and cooked (value-added) Certified Angus Beef® products under license. It is our passion to deliver inspiration, expertise, choice, and possibility across multiple protein categories, to foodservice and retail channels.

GET TO KNOW OUR UNIQUE HISTORY
FOOD
SERVICE

With our dedication to sourcing the finest meat & seafood and our unique processing facilities and capabilities, we welcome you to explore our single-source range of products designed for foodservice professionals. We understand the foodservice landscape, and we make the effort to understand your needs.

GET TO KNOW
FULLY
COOKED

The ability to produce a wide variety of premium fully cooked, custom protein products using authentic techniques, cutting edge innovation and product development expertise in an industry standard setting facility is part of our story and what makes a true Center-of-the Plate Specialist™.

GET TO KNOW
THE
STORE

Not since our bygone days in Toronto’s historic St. Lawrence Market, more than 50 years ago have Macgregors products not been solely exclusive to the restaurant trade. Now, at The Store, our passion and knowledge of operating through seven generations of Canadian family ownership is passed on to those who expect nothing but the best for their steaks, chops & seafood.

Welcome to Kawartha Dairy
For over 80 years, Kawartha Dairy has been proud to be a 100% Canadian-owned company, still operated by the same family that started it back in the beginning. Although it has grown tremendously from its early days, it remains headquartered in Bobcaygeon, Ontario, where it was founded.

In 1937 Jack and Ila Crowe took a leap of faith and bought a small dairy in Bobcaygeon. Jack had learned the trade while working for Oshawa Dairy but the newly renamed Kawartha Dairy didn’t bear much resemblance to that larger big city firm. At that time it consisted of a small, simple three room building, where the cold storage area was cooled with ice cut from the lake.

L'HISTOIRE D'HAFNER

L’histoire d’HAFNER s’écrit depuis 1929, année où Joannès Hafner, horloger de profession, se doit, pour des raisons de santé, de changer de métier. Il choisira la pâtisserie …

Depuis, nous œuvrons chaque jour pour vous proposer des produits toujours plus savoureux. Du sablé Breton à la génoise en passant par les éclairs ou les babas, vous voir utiliser nos produits pâtissiers est une réussite pour nous.

Aujourd’hui, de notre siège à Saint-Galmier – où tout a commencé – au Canada, nous fabriquons dans nos différents ateliers une large variété de produits pâtissiers, offrant aux gourmands un voyage plein de saveurs.

HAFNER, c’est la pâtisserie pour tous, parce que la gourmandise n’est pas un vilain défaut, et ce n’est pas vous qui nous direz le contraire !

FEUILLETEZ NOS CATALOGUES
DÉCOUVRIR
NOS ENGAGEMENTS
Diversité
&
Innovation

Nous avons à cœur de vous proposer une large gamme de produits pour satisfaire tous les usages !

Désireux de vous accompagner toujours plus loin sur la route de la gourmandise, nous cherchons constamment à vous proposer de nouveaux produits.

Dernièrement un disque façon cookie dans la tendance des pâtisseries américaines et une feuille inspiration Madeleine sont venus compléter notre gamme.

Nous vous apportons des solutions prêt-à-garnir, ajoutez-y votre créativité !

Beau
&
Bon

Vous fournir des produits bons et sains est au cœur de nos préoccupations.

Pour cela, nous réalisons une sélection rigoureuse de nos fournisseurs de matières premières et nous nous engageons à limiter au maximum les conservateurs et additifs.

Nous intégrons naturalité et transparence au cœur des développements produits.

Ainsi, notre gamme de kits sérigraphiés est fabriquée exclusivement à partir de colorants d’origine naturelle.

Réactivité
&
Performance

Hafner dispose de plusieurs sites de production performants et flexibles en France et au Canada qui garantissent une grande souplesse et réactivité de production.

Associés à une expertise de plus de 80 ans dans le métier du prêt-à-garnir et à une recherche-innovation continue, nos outils permettent de développer les produits ambiants et surgelés répondant au mieux à vos attentes.

Scotia Harvest Inc. is a vertically integrated seafood company located in Seabrook, Nova Scotia right next to The World Famous Scallop Port of Digby, Nova Scotia. Our processing facility and sales division were previously known as O'Neil Fisheries Limited. Scotia Harvest, along with many of the remaining employees of O'Neil Fisheries, will strive to continue the O'Neil legacy of quality products and decades of experience in the seafood industry.

Over the years, we have continued to grow and adapt to various changes within the fishing industry and global seafood marketplace. Taking advantage of our prime location in the heart of the Bay of Fundy and our dedication to our clients combined with wild-caught seafood, our products and the Royal Fundy Brand have become well established and trusted both domestically and internationally.

Quality seafood products are consistently being received at our new 46,000 square foot state-of-the-art facility from our fleet of vessels, other affiliated or independent harvesters or imported internationally. We then process, grade and pack to individual customer specifications. Depending on the requirements of our customers, our products can be packed fresh, plate frozen, or individually quick frozen. Some customers prefer that we pack products under their own label and this is something we are able and pleased to do.

Our team has many years of experience working in the seafood industry and we would be happy to help you with any of your seafood needs.

ARTISAN BUTCHERY, DONE BY HAND
WHOLESALE BUTCHERY IS PART OF OUR LEGACY

The Butcher Shoppe is a family owned and operated wholesale meat distributor that goes way back to 1984. Throughout the years, our family has gained experience in all areas of the meat business, but our founding principles remain the same: we focus on quality, staying true to the traditional methods of butchery and offering a personal approach to customer service.

Learn More
MEETING YOUR BUTCHERY NEEDS
CHEF-GRADE QUALITY AND CONSISTENCY

You demand impeccable quality and so do we. You’ll get the same trim, tenderness, and flavour in each and every cut, so you can rest easy knowing tomorrow’s order will be just as good as yesterday’s.

PERSONALIZED SERVICE AND CUSTOM ORDERS

Sure, we can keep up with large-scale meat wholesalers, but we’re a family-owned shop at heart. You’ll always be able to get us on the phone to address questions or special requests. We’re flexible!

COST-EFFICIENT WHOLESALE PRICES

Like the chefs we work with, we’re all about trimming the fat and maximizing margins. That’s why we strive to deliver the most competitive price points for a variety of meats without ever sacrificing on quality.

Welcome to Vyefield Enterprises Ltd.



Vyefield Enterprises is a multi-faceted private company that is owned and managed by the Kielstra family. Our family is honoured to provide Western Canadians with a variety of food products and other wares. Vyefield's corporate head office is located in Calgary, Alberta.


Vyefield Enterprises is made up of the following five divisions:
    The Dutch Store - Dutch Import Grocery & Gift Ware
    Mountain View Poultry - Poultry Sales
    Shirra/Panwest Sales - General Merchandise Sourcing, Sales & Distribution

Quality Lobster, Kissed by the Sea!
Clark's Harbour Seafood  Ltd. is a lobster wholesale facility located in the Lobster Capital of Canada.

We specialize in succulent sea-kissed frozen raw and frozen cooked lobster meat and fresh, wild caught, live lobster caught deep in the cold pristine waters of the North Atlantic Ocean, untouched by man until landed on the boat.

Founded by local families, our company has a long history, a legacy that goes back generations.  We are proud to continue this legacy and are proud of the community we live and operate in.

We specialize in shipping live lobster to numerous markets, including Europe, Asia, mainland China, Hong Kong, Japan, the United States and Canada and so we are able to provide our customers with a quality product all year round. Our live lobster is part of a sustainable fishing industry, and as a Canadian Inspection Agency approved plant, our experienced staff can ensure both the quality and safe handling of our products.

We are able to ship in a variety of containers for export by air, using a number of types of cardboard boxes of various sizes to meet your needs.

About us


Founded in Alexandria, Ontario, Lanthier Bakery has focused their energy to make the highest quality products since 1932. As specialists in the production of Brioche, Buns and Bread, the bakery adheres to authentic values of tradition, quality and flavor.  These timeless values have enabled Lanthier Bakery to become one of the largest independent commercial bakeries in Eastern Canada.

Discover our traditional Brioche, Buns and Breads made in Canada!

MORE

Today, in collaboration with its main shareholder, the French company La Fournée dorée, Lanthier Bakery has developed a new range of Brioche Breads and Buns – a niche product – and now aims to specialize in this niche whose demand is growing non-stop.

OUR STORY
PROUDLY OWNED AND OPERATED BY THE GRANDSON OF THE ORIGINAL FOUNDERS, SILANI CHEESE IS STEEPED IN FAMILY HONOUR AND VALUED TRADITIONS; TRADITIONS THAT HAVE HELPED MAKE SILANI ONTARIO’S FASTEST GROWING SPECIALTY CHEESE COMPANY. BY COMBINING TRADITIONAL MASTER WORKMANSHIP AND THE MOST ADVANCED TECHNOLOGIES, SILANI CHEESE HAS PERFECTED THE ART OF CREATING FLAVOURFUL MASTERPIECES!

The quaint township of Schomberg, Ontario has served as the backdrop of our operations since 1954. What began as a small dairy farm fifty years ago, has transformed into an award-winning facility with on-site manufacturing, processing, packaging, storage, distribution, importing, and laboratory testing. Our diverse selection of cheeses can be found at grocery stores and deli counters across the country, but our in-house specialty shop affords us the privilege of meeting with some of our customers everyday.

Now creating over 200 exquisite cheese products, we are proud of our renowned offerings and long history of success. A leader in our industry, the Dairy Bureau of Canada acknowledges Silani Cheese as the first company to produce Mozzarella and Ricotta in Canada. Currently, we produce more Ricotta than any other cheese manufacturer in the country.

With a wide and varying customer base, Silani has developed its business in a highly competitive market through maintaining the highest quality standards, continual product development, and constant innovation. Making first-class choice cheeses is an art, and Silani cheese is a true leader of the trade.

TOTAL FOOD TRANSPARENCY

At One Degree Organic Foods, we believe in the connection between healthy soil, healthy crops, and healthy people. We’re passionate about clean, nourishing foods. And we believe that you deserve 100% transparency in everything you eat. That's why our family has created QR code technology that gives you the power to trace every product and meet the farmers and producers behind every ingredient you’re eating—just like a farmers' market.

OUR COMMITMENT >
TRACE YOUR PRODUCT

All of our packaging features innovative QR code technology, so you and your family can trace ingredients and watch videos of the farmers. Locate the code → Scan with your phone → Learn about the clean, organic ingredients in each One Degree Organics product.

 

Enter the 6-digit source code from the package.

 
MEET THE FARMERS

We travel to farms, co-ops, and processing operations around the world to meet our dedicated and passionate partners face to face.

You've Got Fantastic Taste

Skjodt-Barrett is invested in helping our customers achieve excellence. While we may have a reputation for great tasting ingredients and formulations, our exceptional customer service and expertise are behind our long-term relationships.

Get to know our company and find a high quality supply chain partner trusted by North America’s most beloved brands.

Our Divisions
Custom Ingredients
Since 1985 Skjodt-Barrett has been a collaborative partner within the North American food industry, creating and manufacturing custom ingredients and meal components with a focus on quality and innovation.

As experts in wet food ingredients, we provide ingredient formulation and manufacturing proficiency across a multitude of product categories and packaging formats, servicing a range of industry segments and applications.

With a commitment to our employees and partners of safety first, you can be assured your brand is safe with us.

LEARN MORE
Contract Manufacturing
Trusted by many of North America’s most recognized brands, Skjodt-Barrett is a leading co-manufacturer of retail ready, re-sealable spouted and non-spouted pouch products.

Our competencies include product development and manufacturing of baby food, lunchbox fruit snacks, protein smoothies, salad dressing and condiments.

Our uncompromising commitment to food safety and quality, world class manufacturing and customer-centric approach sets us apart as the preferred and trusted contract manufacturing partner.

LEARN MORE
Why Skjodt-Barrett
A Trusted Partner

For over 35 years, Skjodt-Barrett customers have partnered with us to develop and innovate the joy of food for consumers of all ages.

READ MORE
Industry-Leading Innovation

What drives our dedication to leading innovation in the food industry? From product concept to launch, we live and breathe constant curiosity and creativity.

READ MORE

YOUR MILK REPLACER SPECIALISTS

At Grober Nutrition we provide superior nutrition and management for raising young animals. Milk replacers and milk-based feeds are designed to enhance potential of calves, lambs, kid-goats, piglets, foals, plus an extensive line of zoological and companion animals.

We blend the latest in nutritional research, manufacturing technology, supreme digestibility and animal-growth performance into every product. All with sound economics and value. For 50 years Grober Nutrition has been dedicated to young animal nutrition and is proud to continue to offer you our expertise, right from the start™

A Legacy of Quality.

For 70 years, we have been crafting cookies that consistently deliver homemade taste and quality. From our humble roots as purveyors of the Manning brand, to pioneering private label baking in the 1970s, we have always put the needs of our customers first. Today, we continue this proud tradition as we look forward to continuing our legacy of innovation, focusing on Baking Up Better for our customers, for our people, and for the brands we serve. With two bakeries in Toronto, we are honored to be one of a select few North American bakeries with production exclusively devoted to the private label niche.

We live and breathe quality and sustainability.



Captain Dan’s Seafood has been producing the freshest top-quality seafood for its clients since 1994. From its humble beginnings in a small family-owned plant on the Pointe-du-Chêne Wharf in Shediac, New Brunswick, Canada, it has grown today to more than 200 employees working year-round in a large modern facility in Cap-Lumière, New Brunswick.

Today, Captain Dan’s Seafood sells its products to large retailers, restaurant chains, cruise lines and regional distributors internationally to North America, Asia and Europe. We are still family-owned and managed, too, allowing the personal touch and guidance of owner Norm LeBlanc and his expert staff to shine through.

“We won’t produce anything we won’t eat ourselves,” Norm says. “We live and breathe quality and sustainability. They can’t be separated. We have a deep responsibility to the environment on which we rely for our business.”

NUNAVUT DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION

The Nunavut Development Corporation makes equity investments in target Nunavut economic sectors. These help create income earning opportunities, employment, and local business growth with an emphasis on investing in Nunavut’s smaller communities.

Although not exclusive, NDC prioritizes investments in key sectors of our economy including the fishery, tourism, and cultural industry sectors where many Nunavummiut derive income. NDC has investments in numerous Nunavut corporations ranging from wholly-owned subsidiaries to minority investments with other joint venture partners.

For more information on NDC’s Investment program, please click on the “Investment” tab above or contact us per the information below.

 

 

NDC Financing

An NDC equity investment can be a powerful tool to support the working capital position of a business enterprise.

NDC equity financing can be used to help lever other forms of investment capital for Nunavut business enterprises. This can assist with new business start-ups, or can help businesses to grow or expand.

© 2025 Skotidakis Inc. All rights reserved. Website design by Vortex Solution.   + SHARE

Skotidakis is a goat dairy farm specialized in producing authentic and quality products made from goat milk. Our farm is located in St-Eugene, Ontario and originated from the dream of a man, Peter Skotidakis, who wanted to produce his own version of Greek feta cheese. We are mainly distributed through groceries across Canada and in some parts of the United States. Our growing line of products includes chevre cheese (mot-clé seo), goat Greek yogurt and various dips. The company’s recipes are innovative and always find a way to charm your taste buds.

In addition to groceries, we also operate as a dairy product supplier for different restaurants, manufacturers and distributors. Feel free to tour our website in order to find out more about our products and their unique flavors. Our recipes section will also give you a few appetizing ideas on how to showcase our goat cheese, yogurts and dips in different types of meals. Finally, use the “Find our products” tool to locate a store where you can buy Skotidakis products!

Shop Online

Walcan is delivering seafood straight to your door!
We now service Vancouver Island from Victoria to Campbell River & Quadra Island, plus Surrey, White Rock & Delta with free delivery!

Questions? Reach us at walcaninfo@walcan.com

Shop Now!

A history built on quality, sustainability and CUSTOMER SERVICE.

Walcan began business in 1974 on Quadra Island as a small seasonal bait herring producer. Through the ensuing years, we expanded our customer base from regional to international and our product offerings to include commercially caught seafood products from our locale. In addition, we have developed full service custom processing services for our local aquaculture industry. Since our humble beginnings in 1974, we have not lost sight of what got us to where we are: a focus on product quality, resource sustainability and loyalty to our customers and employees.

Our Story

WHOLESALE SUPPLIERS OF

FORAGE PRODUCTS.

Green Prairie International (GPI) is a respected global wholesale supplier of quality forage products. Located just east of Lethbridge, Alberta, the company has become one of Canada’s premier processors and suppliers of long-fiber timothy and alfalfa hay to valued international markets.

WHAT

WE DO
Green Prairie is always innovating the way of harvesting, compressing and transporting hay worldwide. The latest addition to the company’s equipment is a press for processing round bales.
HAY PROCUREMENT
Through an experienced team of buyers, Green Prairie is able to build relationships with professional farmers growing high-quality crops.
QUALITY ASSURANCE
We are proud to guarantee that the product we deliver consistently meets the needs and expectations of our customers.
OWN FARM / CUSTOM WORK
In addition to buying hay from regional producers, Green Prairie has a facility of its own for growing crops.
CONTAINER SALES
Do you need a container for storage? We have a continuous supply of containers that we sell.
FORAGE EXPORT
Green Prairie is a major exporter of several forage products to all over the world. With our strong customer bases in different markets we are able to sell your products for the best possible prices.
LOGISTICS
Green Prairie benefits from its close proximity to major transportation hubs. With exceptional logistics, you can expect frequent and in-time delivery by truck or by ship.
PRODUCTION / COMPRESSION
Green Prairie’s forage products are compressed into bales that enable easy and efficient handling.
MARKETING FOR OUR CONSUMERS
Our experienced staff maintains close communication with producers and customers to ensure that we stay in touch with the markets and are aware of every situation on the global market.

About Salerno

Salerno Dairy manufactures an extensive selection of traditional Italian cheeses. Its significant repertoire of specialty products includes hard, soft, semi-soft and shredded cheese and cheese blends under the brands Salerno and Gos & Gris. From mozzarella to mascarpone, and romano to ricotta, its products are widely available in retail stores and through major foodservice suppliers.

We Are More Than Meets The Eye
Welcome to Mariposa Dairy
Designed with Delicious in Mind
We Are More Than Meets The Eye
1
2
3

Our passion and focus are simple. We are the leading private label goat and sheep cheese provider in North America, offering custom solutions and innovative products to our partners. Located in the beautiful City of Kawartha Lakes, Ontario, our state of the art facilities have the capacity to scale and meet customer needs, all while maintaining a high standard of quality and taste.

GET TO KNOW US BETTER
Our Partners

We have worked hard to build strong relationships with our distribution partners. These key partnerships allow us to deliver our award-winning goat and sheep cheese products throughout Canada and the United States.

SEE WHO WE WORK WITH
Our Capabilities

Our two facilities cover over 80,000 sq. ft. of production and warehouse space as we operate six different production lines. This allows us the ability to scale our operations to meet our customers’ growing needs.

LEARN MORE ABOUT US
Our Team

Everything we are able to accomplish is due to the hardworking and dedicated individuals that work alongside us. We are seeking to onboard more talent as we continue to scale and grow.

COME WORK WITH US

It takes skilled craftsmen to create the high quality and consistency that we demand. Our cheese experts give each portioned cheese log ample care while preparing with premium ingredients.

GOAT CHEESE 101
Fig and Prosciutto Tagliatelle with Fig Goat Cheese
Baked Mediterranean Goat Cheese Dip
Cranberry Cinnamon Goat Cheese Pinwheels
Lemon Honey Goat Cheese Pound Cake
Fig and Prosciutto Tagliatelle with Fig Goat Cheese
Baked Mediterranean Goat Cheese Dip
Cranberry Cinnamon Goat Cheese Pinwheels
Lemon Honey Goat Cheese Pound Cake
Fig and Prosciutto Tagliatelle with Fig Goat Cheese
Baked Mediterranean Goat Cheese Dip
Cranberry Cinnamon Goat Cheese Pinwheels

Being a leading goat and sheep cheese brand in North America requires dedication, innovation and talent. It is a commitment to working tirelessly, trying and failing until we get it right, and always showing up for those who count on us. We have lived these values since 1989 and have grown from a small farm operation to a thriving business.

MORE

MADE FOR CRACKIN’
MORE
From Our
NORTH ATLANTIC HOME TO YOURS
MORE
Our Story
OBSESSED WITH THE BEST

For three generations now, Daley Seafoods has been processing and selling seafood harvested from the rich and pristine fishing grounds of the North Atlantic. We provide customers around the globe with the tastiest seafood available anywhere. It’s not a job – it’s a family passion.

MORE
HARVESTING DELICIOUSNESS

The clean, icy-cold, and nutrient-rich waters of the Gulf of St. Lawrence are the perfect breeding ground for world-renowned North Atlantic lobster and snow crab. They thrive in this environment, as do a number of other seasonally harvested species. By locating our modern processing plants nearby, we ensure we capture all that texture and taste. The result is seafood that sets a global bar for excellence.

Our Products
LOBSTER TAILS

The biggest treat from one of the ocean’s greatest delicacies.

MORE

Our Products
LOBSTER MEAT

Our North Atlantic Lobster, with its clean, sweet, North Atlantic flavour, is also rich in vitamins and minerals.

MORE

Our Products
SNOW CRAB

This sublime crustacean is world-renowned for both its sweet taste and tender texture.

MORE

Our Products
NORTH ATLANTIC LOBSTER

But its rich, delicious meat is also a tremendous source of protein, and full of rich Omega-3 fatty acids.

MORE

Our Plants
CLOSER MEANS FRESHER

Our processing plants are located close to where the seafood is harvested. Less time lost in transit means fresher tasting seafood. We own four highly modernized seafood plants, all located on the North Atlantic coast. Each is designed and built to process specific seafoods.

MORE
JOIN A TEAM THAT’S BOTH COMMITTED AND RESPECTED

Our company’s reputation is built and maintained by the people who work here. We know and appreciate that. So, we believe that the best way to maintain that reputation is to treat our employees well. If they are paid fairly, given responsibility, and work in a clean and safe environment, they’ll do what it takes to maintain and enhance our standards and reputation. If you are interested in being part of that kind of work environment, we’d like to hear from you.

Cooking and baking are the best ways to bring family and friends together.

When you add Crosby’s Molasses to your recipes you know your guests will keep coming back again and again. The not-so-secret ingredient that packs complex flavours and sweetness into whatever you make. You can always count on our molasses to add a sweet something to your favourite marinade or brighten up your favourite cake. Heck – drizzle it on a slice of fresh baked bread with butter!

Our focus has always been on delivering foods to Canadians. Part of that focus means doing things the right way.

For us, the right way is minimizing our environmental impact, ensuring long term, sustainable farming and transportation practices, and bettering our communities.

We’re proud to feed Canadians the foods they love, and we’re committed to doing that responsibly and ethically. So, when you share our products with your friends and family, you can feel good for all the right reasons.

Our recipes

Whenever you add molasses to your recipes, the final product is always a crowd-pleaser. The sweet tang of molasses always delivers the same quality and flavours you can depend on. We’ve compiled our most popular recipes to help you bring your best to your family and friends, whether you’re entertaining, putting a weeknight meal on the table, or looking for a sweet treat. Discover your new favourite recipe now.

Cooking and baking is the best way to bring family and friends together.

En tant que leader économique et social d’un vaste territoire couvrant la Montérégie, le Centre-du-Québec et l’Estrie, Agiska Coopérative a été fondée par et pour les producteurs. Elle se positionne aujourd’hui comme l’une des coopératives agricoles les plus importantes du Québec, et compte sur la puissance de plus de 5 600 membres ainsi que sur l’expertise de plus de 860 employés dans les secteurs de l’agricole, du commerce de détail, de la machinerie agricole et de la transformation laitière.

Snacking Done Right
We produce an ever-widening range of high quality crackers and snacks for our customers’ brands, priding ourselves on our agile and responsive product development and proactive customer service.

We Want To Be Your Snack Partner
Handi Foods is a manufacturer of a wide variety of crackers and better-for-you snacks for retailers and top-tier brands across North America. With growing demand for our products, we enjoy supply arrangements with retailers representing more than 70% of the North American marketplace including traditional grocery, mass and discount formats. Our growth is driven by our fast-adapt business model whereby we identify and commercialize meaningful product innovation in a nimble, flexible and speedy fashion.

Our products align closely with the growing demand for healthy snacking alternatives and include crackers, chips and crisps in a wide variety of flavours. While we have a full offering of standard products, our flexible manufacturing capabilities also enable us to tailor our formulas to meet your specific needs.

Our Capabilities
Food Safety & Quality Assurance
We are committed to providing our customers and consumers with safe, authentic, great tasting food, consistently meeting specifications as well as statutory and regulatory requirements for food safety, legal compliance and quality.

Our commitment is to bring consistency to our food safety and quality practices through ongoing staff training and equipment upgrades as required and to never to compromise on the food safety, compliance and quality of our products. This requires each of our team members to be engaged, understand their responsibilities and be empowered to take action in order to protect our customers and your brands.

Read More
Programs & Certifications

Handi foods is proud to be certified with a distinguished AA rating under British Retail Consortium (BRC) at both our manufacturing facilities.

Our Story

Handi Foods, originally a family business, was founded by George Haddad, a first-generation immigrant from Lebanon who, inspired by his passion for his Mediterranean roots, established Handi Foods as the original source for quality pita bread in the greater Toronto area.

More than 40 years later, while George has sold the company to ensure its future growth, it is George’s infectious humility, work-ethic and responsiveness to customer needs that inspires how we operate today. At our core, we strive to do the right thing – always – and what is ultimately most important to us is to be consistently recognized for our integrity, dependability, and the quality of the products we make.

Today, Handi Foods has transformed into a manufacturer of a wide range of quality, wholesome, baked snacks available in a variety of forms, textures and tastes. Be it crackers, chips, crisps or puffs, Handi Foods is well-positioned to provide the finest quality products under your brand anywhere in North America.

Responsible Sourcing & Recycling

We are proud members of the Partners in Project Green community, a collaboration initiated by Greater Toronto Airports Authority and Toronto and Region Conservation, dedicated to creating the largest eco-business zone in the world.

As a member of Partners in Project Green, our organization commits to working toward achieving the vision of building an internationally-recognized region known for its competitive, high performance, and eco-friendly business climate.

A Canadian industry leader

Located in L’Anse-au-Griffon (Gaspé Peninsula, Québec), La Crevette du Nord Atlantique inc. specialises in processing northern shrimp (Pandalus borealis). Our main product, distributed under the Caravelle brand, is cooked and peeled northern shrimp, available fresh, frozen or in brine. With our new packaging plant in Rivière-au-Renard, we can offer you the shrimp you’re looking for, in the format of your choice, year round.

Reputed for their exceptional quality and competitive prices, our products are distributed on the Canadian market and abroad. In Canada, our northern shrimp is prized from coast to coast. Elsewhere in the world, our products are enjoyed in the United States, Switzerland, Belgium, and the United Kingdom as well as in Scandinavian countries. Supported by its 150 employees, La Crevette du Nord Atlantique processes nearly 13 million pounds of raw material every year.

Remarkable growth

Incorporated under a Québec charter with several shareholders on December 16, 1980, today, the company is held by trusts owned by the Lapierre and Denis families, who are united by family ties. The founders’ sons, who hold management positions, continue to expand the enterprise to new markets, backed by the unmatched quality of their products.

La Crevette du Nord Atlantique has grown considerably over the years. Since its foundation, production volume has increased fourteen fold while the workforce has quadrupled.

This remarkable growth is the outcome of a series of major investments in the latest equipment.

La Crevette du Nord Atlantique inc.

WELCOME TO SUN-BRITE FOODS INC.

Since 1973 Sun-Brite Foods has been providing consumers with high quality canned tomatoes, sauces, condiments, beans and pasta. Its brand names include Unico and Primo, with a client list that includes Campbell Soup Company, Heinz and many others.

Located in Leamington, Ontario the Tomato Capital of Canada, we are on the same parallel as Northern California. This location allows for better growing conditions in the spring and fall.

With a state of the art facility that is over 750,000 sq ft Sun-Brite Foods can process as much as 180,000 Tons of tomatoes per year and is able to provide our customers with various packaging options to suit their needs. Sun-Brite products make their way into stores from the Maritimes to Vancouver Island.

Sun-Brite Foods...Quality, Integrity and Service is in everything we do.

HEALTHY CHOCOLATES,

Cultivate Better™ Cocoa allows Rogers’ Chocolates to directly impact the long-term sustainability of our cocoa farmers by supporting investments in the cultivation of high-quality cocoa contributing to healthy families, educated communities, diversified incomes and sustainable practice initiatives.

 

LEARN MORE

STEEPED IN TRADITION
RICH WITH HISTORY

The first Rogers’ chocolates were made in 1885 by Charles “Candy” Rogers in the back of his grocery store in Victoria, B.C. In 1903, working with his wife Leah, Charles expanded his chocolate operation across the street to the company's current heritage storefront on Government Street in Victoria.  Today, our chocolates are still made from some of his original recipes.

Why Choose Us

SUSTAINABILITY - ECO-FRIENDLY FROM FARM TO TABLE
PIONEERING TRACEABILITY AND SUPPLY CHAIN EXCELLENCE
From The Fields
Our Farmers & Millers

Habib was born in Sfax in 1960. He has lived among the olive trees all his life. Since he was young, his father taught him how to work with the olive trees. A skill that is still passed down from one generation to another.

Meet Habib

The olive harvest is a time for celebration. Farmers spend days in fields from dawn till dusk, only breaking to drink tea or eat food as they work their magic on this sacred fruit that will bring blessings throughout the year.

Harvest Season

Yousef has a passion for working with olives and derives great joy from just the smell of the olives and the look at the oil flowing like liquid gold throughout the process. He loves his job and finds real pleasure in sharing it with others

Say Hi To Yousef

Growing, harvesting, and producing olive oil is woven into the fabric of life in Tunisia. Over 50,000 farmers work in our orchards and form a strong community centered around these olive trees

Community Empowerment

Our farmers hand-pick the olives, and CHO uses advanced mills to produce the distinct smooth taste of our extra virgin olive oil.

Hand-Harvest

Women account for 60% of the workforce in olive farming in Tunisia. Halima is one of those women farmers whose daily routine changes when it's harvest time and she goes to the fields by sunrise. Halima says that olive fruits need special care to maintain the quality of the oil, and this care is an acquired talent for women.

Our Farmer Women

HIGHLAND PACKERS LIMITED IS A 100% CANADIAN, PRIVATELY OWNED, MEAT PROCESSING AND DISTRIBUTION COMPANY. WE HAVE BEEN PROVIDING STONEY CREEK AND THE GOLDEN HORSESHOE AREA WITH HIGH QUALITY MEAT PRODUCTS FOR OVER 50 YEARS. - OUR COUNTRY MARKET -
HIGHLAND COUNTRY MARKETS IS A SINGLE LOCATION, RETAIL FOOD STORE WHICH IS OWNED AND OPERATED BY HIGHLAND PACKERS LIMITED. UNLIKE A TRADITIONAL GROCERY STORE, HIGHLAND COUNTRY MARKETS IS SPACIOUS, COMFORTABLE AND WELCOMING – IN A UNIQUE COUNTRY MARKET STYLE ENVIRONMENT.  A PLACE WHERE ONLY THE FRESHEST MEAT, PRODUCE AND BAKED GOODS ARE SOLD.

- ABOUT US -
OUR PHILOSOPHY

OFFER ONLY THE FRESHEST, HIGHEST QUALITY PRODUCTS AT THE LOWEST POSSIBLE PRICE.

THE OWNERS OF HIGHLAND COUNTRY MARKETS KNOW THEIR CUSTOMERS WELL – THEIR DIFFERENT TASTES, THE FOOD THEY GRAVITATE TOWARD. FRESH AND HOMEMADE IS AT THE SOURCE OF EVERYTHING HIGHLAND DOES, FROM THE MEAT PREPARED AND MASTERED BY ITS IN-HOUSE BUTCHERS, TO THE ALLURING SMELL OF OLIEBOLLEN (DUTCH DOUGHNUTS) AND APPLE FRITTERS THAT ARE BAKED EVERY SATURDAY FROM 10 A.M. TO 3 P.M.

"GOOD QUALITY PRODUCTS AND CUSTOMER SERVICE ARE OUR MANDATES," SAYS OWNER MARINUS DE JONGE.
THIS RETAIL FOOD STORE IS UNLIKE A TRADITIONAL GROCERY STORE. IT’S A COUNTRY MARKET WHERE ONLY THE FRESHEST MEAT, DELI ITEMS, FRUITS, VEGETABLES AND BAKED GOODS ARE SOLD. A NUMBER OF DAIRY, CHEESES AND COMPLEMENTARY GROCERIES ARE ALSO AVAILABLE.

MARINUS’ ROOTS ARE IN HOLLAND, WHERE HE EARNED HIS MASTER BUTCHER’S DIPLOMA. HIS UNCLES JOHN, MIKE AND BENNY DEJONGE CAME TO CANADA IN 1958 AND STARTED THE MEAT PROCESSING AND DISTRIBUTION COMPANY CALLED HIGHLAND PACKERS. MARINUS, HIS WIFE JANNEKE AND FOUR CHILDREN – FRED, NICK, JANET AND EDWIN – WENT INTO THE FAMILY BUSINESS IN 2005, ALL OF WHICH ARE NOW MARRIED, FRED’S WIFE ERIN, AND NICK'S WIFE TAYLOR HAVE ALSO JOINED THE BUSINESS. NOW, THE FOURTH GENERATION IS ACTIVE IN THE BUSINESS, CONTINUING TO HONOUR THE FAMILY’S ROOTS THAT GO BACK TO HOLLAND WHERE IT ALL STARTED IN THE VILLAGE OF BRESKENS IN 1919.
TODAY, THE DE JONGE FAMILY IS CONTINUING THE FAMILY REPUTATION FOR PROVIDING ONLY THE BEST FOR THEIR CUSTOMERS AND CLIENTS.

HIGHLAND PACKERS AND HIGHLAND COUNTRY MARKETS OFFER DIVERSE FOODS FEATURING MANY FLAVOURS OF THE WORLD, OFFERING HIGH QUALITY BEEF, PORK, LAMB, GOAT AND POULTRY, AS WELL AS HIGHLAND’S OWN DELI PRODUCTS PRODUCED IN THEIR OWN SAUSAGE KITCHEN. ‘FARM FRESH’ IS WHAT HIGHLAND IS ALL ABOUT.

“ALWAYS STRIVING FOR BETTER WAYS TO SERVE, WE WISH TO CONTINUE TO MEET OUR CUSTOMERS’ NEEDS,” SAYS MARINUS WHO, THANKS TO THE MARKET’S CONNECTION TO HIGHLAND PACKERS, CAN OFFER THE GREATEST ASSURANCE OF SELLING ONLY HIGH QUALITY, FRESH, AGED, GOVERNMENT INSPECTED CANADIAN MEATS.

MOST OF THE MARKET’S MEAT PRODUCTS COME DIRECTLY FROM HIGHLAND PACKERS, WHICH IS ADJACENT TO THE RETAIL STORE. THIS CONNECTION SETS HIGHLAND COUNTRY MARKETS APART FROM ITS COMPETITORS.

WE HAVE THE ULTIMATE IN FOOD SAFETY, AS "GOVERNMENT INSPECTORS ARE ON THE PREMISES WHENEVER HIGHLAND PACKERS IS OPERATING,” SAYS MARINUS. AND IT’S ASSURANCE FOR THE DEJONGE’S THAT THEY ARE SELLING QUALITY BEEF, VEAL, PORK, LAMB AND GOAT PRODUCTS. A DEDICATED POULTRY DEPARTMENT IS A FURTHER GUARANTEE OF OUTSTANDING QUALITY.

‘HIGHLAND’S OWN SMOKEHOUSE PROCESSES ITS FAMOUS NATURAL SMOKED HAMS, BACON, GOURMET WIENERS AND DELICATESSEN MEATS.

THE PHILOSOPHY AT HIGHLAND COUNTRY MARKETS IS SIMPLE: OFFER ONLY THE FRESHEST, HIGHEST QUALITY PRODUCTS AT THE LOWEST POSSIBLE PRICE.

“COUNTRY FRESH IS OUR MOTTO AND WE STAND BY IT,” MARINUS SAYS

THE DE JONGE FAMILY INVITES SHOPPERS TO COME SEE FOR THEMSELVES AT 432 HIGHLAND RD. E., SOUTH OF MUD STREET AND NEAR TAPLEYTOWN ROAD, IN STONEY CREEK.

THE MARKET IS OPEN MONDAY TO SATURDAY FROM 7 A.M. TO 6 P.M. THEY ARE CLOSED SUNDAYS.

Our Boats. Our Fish. From our fishermen direct to you. We are proud British Columbians striving to be the leader in sustainable fishing practices.

 

Welcome to Finest At Sea Ocean Products Ltd. We are the leading provider of the finest quality seafood on the West Coast. All our products are 100% wild and are caught by our own fishermen through sustainable fishing practices. We have been operating since 1977 as F.A.S. Seafood Producers Ltd. Finest At Sea was established as a ‘boutique-style’ seafood market here in Victoria.

 

LOCATION

VICTORIA JAMES BAY

27 Erie Street                  Victoria, BC V8V 1P8                      250.383.7760

HOURS:                            SEAFOOD MARKET                DAILY 9:30AM - 6PM                     
FISH & CHIP TRUCK               DAILY  11AM - 7PM              

VANCOUVER KERRISDALE

It is with a heavy heart that we announce the closing our Vancouver location.  After many months of looking, we were unsuccessful in finding a new space to set up shop. 

Our last day of service will be September 15, 2024. 

Please bare with us as our hours way be a bit wonky as staff move on to new  opportunities. 

We thank you for your years of  patronage and for your continued  support of Wild BC Seafood.

Please continue to seek out family owned fishing businesses.  

Tight Lines - Finest At Sea                                   




PRODUCTS

Finest At Sea products consist of a wide variety of wild BC seafood, including: Halibut, Sablefish, Salmon, Spot Prawns, Albacore Tuna, Lingcod, Rockfish, Dungeness Crab, and Local Shellfish. We also boast a onsite smoke house where we do all our own in house recipes for smoked and candied salmon, tuna and our staff favourite sablefish. Combined with state of the art processing, storage facilities, transportation and delivery systems, Finest At Sea products are your #1 choice for the finest seafood on the West Coast.

SHOP SEAFOOD HERE

 

OUR STORY
IT ALL STARTED WHEN…

As a young boy, Bob Fraumeni was fascinated by the sea.  He spent countless hours fishing in Gonzales Bay in Victoria, peering into the ocean, wondering what was down there.  Although he wasn’t born into a fishing family, he was drawn to the sea.  As he got older, a teenage Fraumeni began hanging around the busy docks of Victoria’s Harbour, which at the time had three fish processing plants in full operation.

In 1977, Bob bought his first boat, a 36-foot West Coast troller designed for Salmon fishing.  However, even as he set out on his first trips, Bob Fraumeni knew the salmon industry was going downhill.

“I realized it was time to branch out to other fisheries - especially ground fish,” Bob recalls.

By 1984, Bob’s company had grown and was established as a limited company called F.A.S.Seafood Producers Ltd., which stands for ‘Frozen At Sea.'  F.A.S. now has 8 boats plying the seas, catching everything from Halibut up in Haida Gwaii to Albacore Tuna off the West Coast of Vancouver Island.

After selling exclusively to the Asian Market for many years, Bob was eager to make his high quality products available locally.  ‘Finest At Sea’ was established as a boutique-style seafood company with locations in Victoria and Vancouver, B.C.  Bob recognized your need for a source of top quality, 100% wild seafood products of known origin and now the Finest At Sea Products are just a phone call away.

BEST FISH & CHIPS IN TOWN
OUR FLEET

Finest At Sea has ten large offshore fishing vessels, including the FV: Ocean Pearl, the largest vessel in the B.C. fishing fleet.  Our vessels are equipped with cutting-edge, deep cold (-60º) freezing systems.  As any experienced fish buyer knows, freshness can only be guaranteed when the time between expiration and freezing is measured in minutes.

FV OCEAN PEARL

This impressive 130ft ship leads our fishing fleet. Year round the 'Ocean Pearl' is catching Sablefish, along with some Halibut and Rockfish. 

FV SCANIA QUEEN

Our ‘Queen’ reels in Spring, Coho, and Pink Salmon for us. Captained each summer by our fearless leader Bob Fraumeni while he mentors future fishers.

FV MALAHAT II

The Malahat isn't just the stretch of highway between Victoria and Duncan... it also is the name of a member of our fleet!  She fishes for Albacore Tuna, Halibut and Lingcod

FV NORDIC SPIRIT

This 56’ member of our fleet, catches Spot Prawns, Halibut, Tuna and Sablefish. It is set up for various sustainable catch methods including, traps and long-lining

FV HANNA LIO

The 'Hanna Lio' longlines for Halibut, and Sablefish but also brings in our, Rockfish, and Lingcod as some tasty bi-catch

FV STAR WARS II

The Star Wars II is one of our largest ships, but it packs one of our smallest fish: herring. Beyond Herring Packing, the Star Wars II also brings in Halibut and goes on some very impressive Ghost Gear Recovery missions 

FV NORDIC RAND

You can find the 'Nordic Rand' reeling in Tuna, Spot Prawns, Sablefish, and Halibut.

FV SALMON KING

This Tuna-catching machine finds its home south of the border as part of our US fleet.

The 'Conquest' makes up the other half of our US fleet.

 

SHOP NOW

Masterfeeds, an Alltech company, has been a leading nutrition provider for animal agriculture in Canada since 1929. Our long history of serving Canadian livestock and poultry producers is the success of employing quality, motivated people, and of offering nutrition solutions that support milk, meat, and egg production excellence. Producing Delicious Nutritional Food Bars

Our Product Perspective

Quality excellence is deeply ingrained in everything we do. We’re driven to constantly raise the bar, embracing top standards, certifications, and thoughtfully developed formulations to ensure our products meet your highest expectations.

Quality Food Manufacturing.
Third Party Audits - Our facilities are third-party audited for quality assurance, food safety and food security.
Technology - We have a robust quality management system utilizing digital plant management platforms and collaborative robotics.
People – Every phase of your product's journey is meticulously overseen by our exceptionally educated and specially trained Quality Assurance team.
READ MORE
Our Defining Qualities

Our mission is to develop and manufacture delicious, innovative, quality food bars that exceed the standards of the world’s largest retailers and brands, while embracing the original values of our longstanding family operation. Our approach is systematic: define, measure, analyze, implement, control and perpetually refine.

Efficiency

Quality control, automation, and consistent employee training are just some of the ways we ensure that our production capabilities are as efficient as possible.

Quality

Nutri-Nation is committed to the highest standards of quality and safety. Our facilities are third-party audited for quality assurance, food safety, and food security.

Knowledge

Our multi-disciplinary team of product and process designers deliver a wealth of experience and forward-thinking, industry-leading knowledge.

Waste Reduction

Our processes are designed to control and manage the Lean Manufacturing waste types: transportation, inventory, motion, waiting, overprocessing/overdesign, overproduction and defects.

Innovation

From the newest developments in robotics to the latest advances in nutritional science, we look to maintain leadership positions in all aspects of our industry.

Continuous Improvement

Driven by our strong commitment to achieving excellence, we continuously fine-tune our systems, processes, products, and services, using a holistic approach to consistently enhance their effectiveness and efficiency.

We’re excited to hear from you!

Quality. Availability. Traceability. Sustainability. Passion.
It’s what sets Presteve apart.
Quality

At Presteve, the fact that we manage every step of the process is reflected in our high-quality product. From hauling in the nets full of fresh caught fish to delivering your order to your door, high standards are met every step of the way. 

Traceability & Sustainability

Each load of fish we bring in from the fresh Great Lakes water can be traced back to the boat it came from and the day it was caught. Presteve takes every measure to ensure fish and seafood are harvested in an environmentally-conscious manner.

Delivered fresh & fast!

Presteve is uniquely able to secure product availability year-round through a vital combination of quota ownership and strategically-positioned multi-plant processing near water’s edge. Our trucking and delivery is best in the business due to our precise logistics management that gets our fish from lakefront to storefront on time, as ordered.

We do fresh caught best

Presteve is #1 in delivering wild-caught, fresh-water fish to North America. We are on the lakes, year round, catching, processing, delivering the fish consumers want most…and in abundance.

OUR COMMITMENT
SOURCING WE’RE PROUD OF

DOM is committed to sourcing our farmed seafood products from organic-certified or Aquaculture Stewardship Council (ASC)-certified suppliers. If organic-certified or ASC-certified products are not available, our minimum sourcing standard for farmed products is GLOBAL G.A.P. For wild products, we commit to sourcing MSC-certified fish and seafood as a priority. DOM has a full-chain traceability policy in place to support our sustainable seafood commitment: tracing product scientific name, geographic origin, farmed or wild, and gear type or farming method. As of today, our seafood purchases meet 100% of this commitment.

Finding greener, cleaner food sources is important to our global future. Animal farming, overpopulation, and overfishing have the greatest impacts on our planet, and making sustainable choices is an easy and powerful way to minimize these effects. New technology within the fishing industry has led to stricter guidelines and higher standards for raising fish, meaning less intrusion on the environment.
Responsible sourcing and fishing is about supporting healthier oceans. All DOM seafood products are responsibly sourced–farmed or harvested from select locations around the world. We began our journey with Norwegian Fjord, sustainably sourced salmon from the cold waters of Norway. All DOM seafood are products you can feel good about buying and about eating. We care about our oceans and the ecosystems that need to be safeguarded. We’ve also developed a line of organic products that help to protect and preserve ecosystems. All DOM Organics products are free of any chemicals, antibiotics, or hormones, and fish are fed an organic, GMO-free diet. Making a choice to support responsible fishing is easy–you can do it every time you purchase seafood. Whether shopping for your restaurant or for your family, choose responsibly. Choose DOM.

LEARN MORE
OUR SEAFOOD
A QUEST FOR EXCELLENCE
DOM International is all about bringing you the world’s finest seafood. We’ve ventured around the world to find the best our oceans have to offer and, on this quest of excellence, have developed a line of distinct products. Norwegian Fjord salmon is authentically Scandinavian, raised in the deep, glacier-fed waters of Norway–from our traditionally smoked salmon and gravad lax to our fresh salmon. DOM Organics is a clean, green choice and features certified-organic seafood, raised without the use of antibiotics, hormones, or chemicals, including Organic Shrimp, Organic Mussels, and Organic Salmon. DOM Reserve puts the restaurant in your kitchen–chef-inspired, pre-seasoned cedar-planked salmon, escargots, marinated salmon portions, and smoked salmon; add something special to your table with ease. DOM Specialty is quality, pre-packaged smoked salmon priced for every day–great for busy, on-the-go lifestyles. From poaching and steaming to grilling and roasting, preparing seafood doesn’t have to be difficult. We’ve provided a list of Cooking Tips & Tricks with easy instructions for cooking fish like a professional. Not sure how to handle seafood? Don’t worry–we’ve provided advice on that, too! Steamed mussels, grilled shrimp skewers, roasted parmesan-crusted salmon–you can do it all with help from DOM. Planning a weekend brunch? Looking for ways to get more seafood into your family’s diet? Need a new seafood dinner recipe? Discover everything from elegant seafood appetizers and heart-healthy mains to hearty pastas and kid-friendly dishes for every occasion. Let’s Eat!

Welcome to Barbours
	
We Can Help Bring Your Products to Market

Welcome to Barbours. With more than 150 years of food manufacturing experience, we have the expertise and commitment to quality you would expect from a world-class food processor. 

We specialize in peanut butter and almond butter manufacturing and co-packing, tea manufacturing and co-packing, snack seasoning manufacturing and co-packing, and spice and extract manufacturing and co-packing. Barbours also proudly produces our own consumer brands including King Cole Tea, AASANA Relax Herbal Tea, Pop ‘N’ Top Popcorn Seasoning, FATSO and Nuts About Peanut Butter.

Whether you need high-quality ingredients for your brand, or you’d like us to co-manufacture something to your specs, our team can deliver the consistent quality you need.

Co-manufacturing.
Flexible.
Efficient.

Large or small, standard or specialized, even certified organic – we help our partners with high quality custom co-manufactured products. 

We can custom craft peanut and almond butters, tea blends, spices, seasonings, artificial and pure vanilla extracts to meet your specifications. Our goal is to provide our partners with consistent, dependable, high-quality products on time and in full…every time. Barbours provides complete co-manufacturing and co-packing solutions.

We know tea manufacturing. Choose from one of our house blends, have our Tea Specialist create something unique, or let us blend to your specification.

Whether it's private label development, foodservice, or even adding one of our existing consumer brands to your retail shelves, we guarantee Barbours is your “cup of tea”.

We’ll roast and grind to your specification, add a variety of inclusions to create the perfect recipe, and then pack and deliver in your ideal packaging solutions.

Creamy? Crunchy? Organic? No problem. Need Kosher, Gluten Free, Non GMO, Vegan certifications? No problem. We have your needs covered.

Our experts search for the best flavors, textures and aromas from all over the world. We grind and pack spices and dry ingredients in a variety of bottles, pouches and jars. Our focus is ensuring the best quality at reasonable prices.

We blend and bottle flavor extracts, in a variety of glass or PET containers. Whether you’re searching for a pure or artificial vanilla extract supplier, or have bottling requirements for another shelf stable liquid product, another liquid extract, Barbours has the flexibility to meet your needs.flavor extracts are your recipe for success.

Our Brands

From tea to peanut and almond butters, to spices and extracts, our brands are enjoyed by thousands of families every day. If you’re looking to broaden your retail peanut butter, tea, spices and extract product mix to offer more quality choices for customers, we can fulfill that order.

The Barbours Difference

When you work with Barbours, you get the best of 150 years of Canadian food manufacturer experience, with a dedicated team of R&D product specialists, master blenders, expert production team, customer service reps, and all with a focus on quality and dependability.

We source great ingredients, we customize recipes to suit our clients needs, and we never compromise on quality. The result is reliability and consistency with every batch. Plus we work really hard to offer a wide variety of production and packaging options.

Quality Focused

WHY WE'RE DIFFERENT
NOURISHING COMMUNITIES • SUSTAINABILITY • FAMILY OWNED

Arran and Ratana Stephens established Nature's Path in 1985, emerging as pioneers of the organic movement from the outset. Our commitment to stewardship of the land remains steadfast. As a family-owned company, we prioritize giving back. To date, we've contributed over $3 million to our partner organizations. While our roots lie in organic endeavors, we're equally dedicated to ambitious environmental sustainability objectives.

OUR GIVE BACK
OUR STORY
OUR MOST POPULAR GRANOLA – 
PERFECT LITTLE CLUSTERS

❝ This is my absolute favorite granola cereal! I love that is isn't too sweet and that is has pumpkin and flax seeds. The flavor is amazing and the granola stays crunchy long enough to eat to an entire bowl. If you prefer it a little softer you can always let it soak in the milk for a few moments before digging in. I like to eat mine with vanilla almond milk and it is amazing! ❞

QUALITY PRODUCTS

Our commitment to providing the highest quality products for BC families is the cornerstone of our success. Fresh products, reliable quality, and exceptional service are what keep customers coming back to Johnston’s.

LOCAL MARKETS

We are rooted in British Columbia and are committed to providing high-quality and safe food for BC families. We remain focused on local markets, providing our products to BC only.

EMPLOYMENT

We believe that our employees are the measure of our success. Through our excellent training program, we ensure that our employees are well prepared to be safe at work. We want our staff to be confidently proud of the role they play at Johnston’s. Teamwork and a spirit of cooperation are how we get the job done!

If you are interested in joining our team, please APPLY today!

QUALITY PROMISES

We have a clear standard of care for all animals that are raised to be delivered to Johnston’s. BC producers are pleased to meet these high standards and we are happy to work with and assist them in achieving these standards.

EVERYONE DESERVES A LITTLE DAINTY

AT DAINTY, WE BELIEVE THAT EVERYONE IS ONE OF A KIND.

Our premium rice varieties are designed to fit seamlessly into your life—simple to prepare, incredibly delicious, and a celebration of your individual creativity in the kitchen. We are the only company to be milling rice right here in Canada since importing the first cargo of rice in 1882.

Whether you’re following a recipe or improvising with flavours, you’re guaranteed to create something amazing with Dainty rice. So go ahead and celebrate your unique culinary style with Dainty — because like everyone, you also deserve a little Dainty!

Avantis, une coopérative d’envergure du réseau Sollio Groupe Coopératif

Avantis Coopérative compte sur la force de plus de 15 650 membres producteurs agricoles, entrepreneurs et consommateurs ainsi que sur l’expertise de 1 350 employés. Très diversifiée, Avantis est présente dans les régions de la Chaudière-Appalaches, de l'Estrie, de la Capitale-Nationale, de la Mauricie, des Laurentides, du Bas- Saint-Laurent, de la Côte-Nord, et au Nouveau-Brunswick. Opérant plus de 90 places d’affaires sous les bannières Sollio Agriculture, BMR, New Holland, Wacker Neuson et Sonic est la plus importante coopérative du réseau Sollio Groupe Coopératif.

Notre Expertise
Matières premières

Nous importons et offrons différents types de thés, d'herbes et d’épices provenant de divers pays d'origine. Nous créons des mélanges selon le goût et la granulométrie désirés. Nous facilitons la production par des mélanges pré-faits ou sur mesure.

Nous sommes très fiers d'être un fournisseur pour des compagnies du domaine de l'agroalimentaire: micro-brasserie, distillerie, kombucha et bien d’autres.

Marque privée

Vous désirez une recette exclusive ou des fonctionnalités distinctes pour votre propre marque? Nous disposons des capacités techniques pour vous aider.

Nous développons des mélanges de thé, d'herbes et d'épices selon le type de sachet et l'emballage recherché.

Service alimentaire

Au fil des ans, nous avons acquis une expertise répondant aux besoins du service alimentaire. Notre clientèle comprend les chaînes de restaurants, les restaurateurs indépendants, les hôtels, les traiteurs, les distributeurs et les grossistes.

Nous proposons des gammes de thés et tisanes ensachés avec des formats propres à ce secteur.

Nourriture animale

Nous fournissons des herbes, des fruits & légumes, des épices et des arômes pour des manufacturiers de nourriture pour animaux. Nous concevons des mélanges exclusifs pour simplifier l'approvisionnement et la production.

Les avantages Trans-Herb e

Selon les demandes des clients, plusieurs certifications sont possibles : Biologique (NOP, COR Union Européenne), NON GMO Project, Équitable, Kosher.
Nos produits sont exempts des allergènes suivants : amandes, noix du Brésil, noix de cajou, noisettes, noix de macadamia, pacanes, pignons, pistaches, noix, arachides, sésame, blé ou triticale, oeufs, lait, soja, crustacés et mollusques, poisson, moutarde, gluten et sulfites.
Nos installations sont enregistrées auprès de la FDA et équipées pour la production de « Dietary Supplement » américain.
Expertise dans la création de produits de santé naturels (Licence 300083 par Santé Canada).
Nous pouvons offrir à nos clients différents services : le développement de nouveaux produits , l’expertise réglementaire (alimentaire, produit santé naturel), la production, l’approvisionnement, et plus encore.
La nature à votre portée

Nous sommes une entreprise familiale canadienne, importatrice d'herbes et d'épices. Notre expertise unique en approvisionnement d'ingrédients et en recherche et développement nous permet d'offrir un monde innombrable d'opportunités pour vos projets d'affaires.

À PROPOS DES TRANSFORMATEURS

En collaboration avec les pêcheurs, les transformateurs du Québec réussissent à mettre sur les marchés intérieurs et extérieurs des produits de très haute qualité dont la reconnaissance se traduit par une très forte demande.

À PROPOS DE L'AQIP
L’Association québécoise de l’industrie de la pêche (AQIP) est un organisme à but non lucratif, fondé en juin 1978 par les entreprises de transformation de produits marins des régions maritimes du Québec. Elle assure la défense de leurs intérêts auprès des instances concernées.
